Flutter Developer Job at Zojatech Limited




        
    

        
        Zojatech Limited - We are a digital transformation consultancy and software development company that provides revolutionary and effective software solutions to businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Flutter Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	This position is responsible for the design, development, testing and deployment of software systems that meets customer requirements.
	The role also involves sitting within the IT team of a business, and will be involved in liaising with the Business Analysts and Development Managers to ensure software projects meet requirements.


Job Responsibilities


	Design and build advanced applications for the iOS / Android platform
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
	Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
	Manage testing and bug fixes
	Prepare technical documentation
	Implement software enhancements and suggest improvements
	Proven work experience as a Mobile developer
	Demonstrable portfolio of released applications on the App store or the Android market
	In-depth knowledge of at least one programming language like Dart React native,,Swift and Java
	Experience with third-party libraries and APIs
	Familiarity with OOP design principles
	Excellent analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude
	Ability to perform in a team environment.


Qualifications


	BSc Degree in Computer Science or relevant fields with 3 - 5 years of work experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward CVs to: career@zojatech.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Business Development Expert Job at Deradelight Technologies




        
    

        
        Deradelight is an innovation-driven tech startup based in FUTO, Imo State, committed to empowering businesses through smart digital solutions that keep them ahead of the curve. Through our Tech Academy, we are also bridging the digital skill gap by equipping individuals, youths, and corporate teams with future-ready, in-demand tech skills necessary to thrive in today’s digital economy.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Expert

Job Location: Futo, Owerri - Imo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are currently seeking self-motivated, result-oriented, and proactive individuals to join our team as Business Development Experts. This role is vital to driving our growth, expanding our client base, and boosting enrollment in our training programs.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and establish strategic training partnerships with schools, churches, companies, and community organizations.
	Drive student enrollments for our tech bootcamps and training programs through digital and on-ground marketing initiatives.
	Plan, organize, and represent Deradelight Academy at seminars, campus events, and tech fairs to promote course offerings.
	Secure website and software development projects with institutions such as schools, hotels, churches, and businesses.
	Engage clients effectively and negotiate favorable terms for services rendered.
	Prepare daily and weekly business development reports to track progress and strategy effectiveness.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related fields.
	2–3 years of proven experience in sales, business development, or partnership management.
	Strong online presence and active social media engagement.
	Excellent network within youth and school communities.
	Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales/enrollment targets.
	Understanding of EdTech, digital training trends, and IT services.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Self-starter with strong time management and organizational capabilities.
	Familiarity with CRM tools and Microsoft Office Suite.


Compensation Package


	Base Salary: N100,000 per month


Performance-Based Commissions:


	N3,000 for every confirmed student enrollment during bootcamps or training programs
	N15,000 for every partnership secured with schools, churches, hotels, or businesses
	N15,000 for every website or software development deal closed.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV and a compelling cover letter explaining why they are the ideal candidate for this role to: deradelight@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Logistics / Admin Assistant",
  "description": "Solidarites International (SI)&nbsp;is an international humanitarian NGO which, for more than 40 years, has been providing assistance to populations affected by armed conflicts and natural disasters by meeting their vital needs for food, water and shelter. Particularly involved in the fight against diseases linked to unsafe water, the first cause of death in the world, SI&#39;s interventions provide expertise in the field of access to drinking water, sanitation and hygiene promotion, but also in the essential area of food security and livelihoods. Present in around twenty countries, SI&#39;s teams - 2000 people in total made up of expatriates, national staff, permanent staff at headquarters, and a few volunteers - work with professionalism and commitment while respecting cultures.

Solidarit&eacute;s International (SI) is determined to prevent and fight all type of abuse &ndash; all act of exploitation, abuse and/or sexual harassment (SEAH) against members of beneficiary communities or collaborators, fraud, corruption, violation of persons and/or property, funding of activities harmful to human rights &ndash; that could be perpetrated in the frame of its interventions. SI implements a zero-tolerance policy regarding acts of SEAH.&nbsp;Solidarit&eacute;s International is an equitable employer committed to find all forms of discrimination. SI will never ask for any remuneration to take part in a recruitment process.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics / Admin Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Mission

	Monitor changes in the cost of living


Team management:


	Train and support team members under his or her supervision
	Ensure the minimal replacement of members of the admin services in case of absence (days of, sickness etc.)
	Evaluate team members under his or her supervision.
	Prepare shift planning for drivers.


Treasury / accounting / management:

	Issue vouchers, supervise archiving of records.
	Participate in audits or any checks issued by partners or head office, at the base level.

	Monitor due dates for payments of contracts managed by the administrative coordinator.

	Carry out pay-outs and advances, within established guidelines.
	Keep the registry of cash pay-outs and the cashier&rsquo;s register.
	Record budgetary transfers and keep accounting codes.
	Verify, before recording, that records conform to the regulations and procedures of Solidarit&eacute;s International.
	Translate accounting documents if necessary.
	Exchange currencies at request of superiors
	Verify cash balances daily and report any discrepancies to superiors.
	Archive accounting records according to Solidarit&eacute;s procedures after a final verification of receipts etc.
	Guarantee security of the cash and confidentiality of information.


Reporting / communication:


	Participate in supervision of regulations in effect.
	Aid admin coordinator in relations with administrative authorities


Logistics Management:
Management of supplies:


	Carrying out and adhering to Solidarites International purchase procedures.
	Verify and process quote requests and IOFs.
	Prepare and Archive purchase folders for Abuja office.
	Implement purchases, monitor adherence to validation regulations and procedures.
	Negotiate prices, deadlines, and methods of delivery.
	Ensure that relationship with suppliers is monitored.
	Organize and supervise all logistics aspects and documentation for good/supplies transport, waybills, packing lists, final delivery/distribution records.
	Carry out regular stock checks and physical inventories count by using SI stock report on monthly basis.
	Follow up on the expiry date of first aid kit and fire extinguishers in the Office and GH and replenish them on a timely basis.

	Assist in the planning and execution of service work on vehicles.
	Organize daily movement of vehicles.
	Ensure that a toolbox and First Aid kit are available on board all vehicles and ensure drivers check that kit is always complete.
	Ensure that vehicle logbooks are in place and are used correctly.
	Monitor the administrative documents for all vehicles.
	Tracking of movement from or to the airport.
	Ensure weekly vehicle checklist template is filled by the driver(s).


Management of IT equipment/Telecommunications:


	Assist in installing necessary programs as well as required update and securing materials.
	Assist in monitoring and maintaining materials.
	Assist in the planning and execution of service work on equipment.
	Ensure the maintenance of IT equipment by communicating with IT responsible.


Management of Office and GH:
Premises Management:


	Ensure all premises issues and coordinate/supervise troubleshooting.
	Ensure regular maintenance of Solidarit&eacute;s installations/equipment/facilities, notably through a preventative maintenance plan (procedures, scheduling etc).



	Check the availability of enough consumables and materials in stock for routine repairs and ensure their management; transmit orders for stock replenishment timely.
	During the execution of work, ensure the safety and security of the premises.
	Ensure and supervise the maintenance and upkeep of premises.


Profile Forsaken

	Languages: Fluency in English compulsory - written &amp; spoken (Hausa &ndash; Added Advantage)

	Personal qualities: well organized, able to prioritize and manage important workload, good learning capacity and a fast learner, good communication, reactive, assertive, great attention to details, resistance to stress.


What We Offer
Salary + Transport &amp; housing contribution + Leave allowance + social benefits (medical coverage, 24 days of Annual leaves per year, compassionate leaves, public holidays as announced by government, festive bonus, Life insurance - covering death and permanent disability) etc.

Note


	Qualified female candidates are strongly encouraged to apply.

	The CV attached must be named with your first name and surname.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Marketing Manager will develop and execute marketing strategies that will attract and retain retail and corporate forex clients, increase transaction volumes, and grow brand visibility in line with regulatory restrictions.
	The Marketing Manager must balance creative market growth initiatives with compliance with CBN’s marketing and communication guidelines.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute integrated marketing plans targeting high-net-worth individuals, SMEs, corporate clients, and travelers.
	Define and maintain the brand identity and ensure consistency across all channels.
	Position the BDC as a reliable, secure, and fast forex partner.
	Identify and target potential forex buyers (travelers, importers, students, corporates).
	Develop customer segmentation and execute targeted campaigns.
	Establish and nurture client relationships to promote loyalty and referrals.
	Supervise digital platforms including the company website, WhatsApp Business, Google My Business, Instagram, and LinkedIn.

	Coordinate offline efforts such as corporate visits, branded gifts, pop-up stands, and strategic partnerships.
	Work with compliance/legal team to ensure that all campaigns meet CBN’s advertising guidelines for BDCs.
	Avoid unauthorized promotions such as exchange rate advertisements or public rate displays unless approved.
	Monitor forex industry trends, customer behavior, and competitor activities.
	Provide insights into product/service improvements and customer experience enhancements.
	Manage marketing budgets effectively and report on ROI and KPIs.
	Supervise the marketing team and coordinate with external vendors, agencies, or content creators.


Qualifications and Experience


	Minimum of a BSc. Or an HND degree in Marketing, Mass Communication, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in marketing or sales, preferably in financial services, fintech, or BDC.
	Professional certifications in digital marketing, brand management, or CRM (e.g. CIM, HubSpot, Google Ads) are an advantage.
	Knowledge of Crypto, USDT, is an added advantage.
	Experience in marketing regulated financial products is a strong asset.
	Deep understanding of financial marketing within a regulated environment
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Creativity, brand storytelling, and campaign planning
	Strong networking and client relationship management skills
	Proficiency in digital tools (Canva, Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, Excel, CRM platforms)
	Ethical marketing practices and attention to compliance boundaries
	Must demonstrate professionalism, discretion, and reliability
	Track record of meeting lead generation and client acquisition KPIs


Salary
N600,000 monthly (commission to be agreed upon).

Quality Assurance Officer Job at BAFashion Shop




        
    

        
        BAFashion is a fast-growing fashion and lifestyle brand focused on offering trendy, budget-friendly, and quality clothing for the modern customer.

Our aim is to create a smooth shopping experience through innovation, consistency, and excellent customer service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Officer

Job Location: Ketu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented Quality Assurance Officer to inspect garments and ensure every item meets customer expectations and internal quality standards.
	This role requires basic tailoring knowledge and a sharp eye for finishing, accuracy, and garment condition.


Key Responsibilities


	Inspect garments to confirm they match customer orders
	Check finishing, measurements, and overall garment condition
	Identify and flag defects or quality issues before delivery
	Maintain quality records and report recurring issues.


Requirements


	ND or HND in any field
	Minimum of 1 year of experience in garment quality control or tailoring
	Basic tailoring knowledge is essential
	Strong attention to detail and ability to follow specifications.


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
